Description: Fragment of the neck of a black figure Clazomenian painted pottery slim neck-amphora; Siren with head turned back, to left. Purple fillet and stripe along upper part of wing. White face, neck, chest. Details on white incised.
Curator's comments: This sherd may be from the same pot as Pl. GB 585 (BM GR 1888,0208.79.a). If the incision is ignored, the contour of the white paint of the face is normal. BSA xlvii, 128-under B.13.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 587, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 122)
